name: emsesp-mcp-server
description: A Model-Context-Protocol (MCP) Server to interact with Bosch/Buderus heat pumps via EMS-ESP

ems_esp_url.title: EMS-ESP URL
ems_esp_url.description: The URL of your EMS-ESP gateway, e.g. 'http://ems-esp' or 'http://ems-esp.local' or 'http://192.168.1.10'

tools.name: get-states
tools.description: State information like heating active or current modulation

tools.name: get-pumps
tools.description: Information about PC0, PC1 and circulation pump

tools.name: get-eheater
tools.description: Information about energy consumption, runtime, status, etc. of your electrical aux heater

prompts.name: show-dhw-settings
prompts.description: Shows the settings for domestic hot water preparation in table format
prompts.text: Show me a matrix for the domestic hot water (dhw) settings of my heatpump via ems-esp-mcp. Show start temperatures, stop temperatures and differential temperatures as columns, and as rows use eco, eco+, comfort, disinfection and onetime.

prompts.name: show-heat-curve
prompts.description: Shows the configured heat curve as a graph
prompts.text:
Show the heat curve with the following elements in a graph with the outside temperature on the x-axis and the target flow temperature on the y-axis and the following points defining the curve:
 - (minexttemp / designtemp)
 - (summertemp / minflowtemp)
Additionally, show as a horizontal line the maxflowtemp
